summary: Phoebe Curtis Orr is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll certification reports for the committee, specifically for the periods of February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977. The documents list her name alongside other committee staff, indicating she was compensated for her work during these periods. The payroll certifications confirm that she performed her assigned duties.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Phoebe Curtis Orr's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in the provided documents, her presence on the payroll suggests she contributed to the committee's work during the specified periods.
